attributes.action: Make today (the 26th of March 2020) National Key-Workers Day.
attributes.additional_details: The government has previously called these people 'low-skilled' workers and to prove to the nation that they see how vital they are, they should create a day to commend their hard work.
attributes.background: Everyday, millions of Britons continue to go to work to keep our country running. From NHS staff, to delivery drivers and supermarket staff, without these incredible selfless people, many more would suffer.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to acknowledge the role of the NHS, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do. The Government is not responsible for designating "national days".

We have started a petition calling on the Government to create a new Bank Holiday in to thank those who helped during the Covid-19 crisis, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882

We have also started a petition calling on the Government to award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
